summary: The Mental Health for Latinos Act of 2025 aims to improve behavioral and mental health outcomes in Hispanic and Latino communities. It mandates the Secretary, through the Assistant Secretary, to develop an outreach and education strategy to reduce stigma associated with mental health conditions and substance abuse. This strategy will consider diverse cultural and language needs, increase awareness, provide information on evidence-based treatments, involve community members, and promote a comprehensive public health approach. The bill authorizes $1,000,000 for fiscal year 2026 for this initiative and requires annual reports to Congress.
